actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A bill to return Congress, through the implementation of procedural reforms, the ability to insure that rules and regulations promulgated through the administrative process shall reflect the intent of Congress.

summary.text: Regulatory Control Act of 1979 - Requires rules promulgated by an executive or military department to implement a public law to be submitted to the congressional committee where such law originated. Prohibits such rule from becoming effective if disapproved by such committee within 60 days of submission.

titles.title: A bill to return Congress, through the implementation of procedural reforms, the ability to insure that rules and regulations promulgated through the administrative process shall reflect the intent of Congress.
